text: In this video, we will show you

how to find your Instagram
URL on a desktop web browser
and a trick for figuring out your URL
using the Instagram app.

If you're using a web
browser to view Instagram,
it's quite easy to find your unique URL.

Open your profile page by
clicking your username.
At the top of the page,
you can find your URL in the address bar.
You can copy and share this link anywhere.

You can find your URL
using the Instagram app
by piecing it together manually.

Tap your account icon to
go to your profile page.
Once you've opened your profile,

you can find your username
above your profile picture.

Your Instagram URL is
made up of two parts.

The first part is
Instagram's website address,
which is www.instagram.com.
And the second part is your username.

All you need to do is add a
slash at the end of that link

and your Instagram
username right next to it.
That link will lead to your profile.
Keeping this URL structure in mind,

you can navigate to other
people's profiles this way.

But do keep in mind that some
Instagram accounts are private

and may not be visible,
even if you have their URL.

Deactivated Instagram
accounts are also not visible.
Check out more social-media tips
by checking out our social-media playlist,

found in the playlists
tab of this channel page.
